pr_title: Add TraceProcessor and move some existing functionality to rules

timeline.bodyText: Note, minor risk of a breaking change here in exchange for better consistency.
timeline.author: tylerbenson

timeline.message: Stop setting error tag and update tests.

timeline.bodyText: This change seems unrelated; why are we making it?
timeline.author: dougqh

replies.bodyText: This is related to the removal of OperationDecorator.
replies.author: tylerbenson

timeline.bodyText:
I'm debating whether placing the list of Rules in the TraceProcessor is the right choice.
An alternative would be to associate a set of rules with a span as construction, but to defer execution until the end.
I'm not sure if that's better or not in this case -- just suggesting an alternative.
timeline.author: dougqh

replies.bodyText: I see how that could work, but not sure if it would offer significant benefit.
replies.author: tylerbenson

timeline.bodyText:
The List + the loop in onTraceComplete effectively comprise a CompositeRule.
I think it might be better to explicit introduce a CompositeRule class.
timeline.author: dougqh

timeline.bodyText: Mongo special case here for Mongo strikes me as problematic from both an encapsulation & maintenance standpoint.  This really makes me think that we might be better off attaching rules as each span construction -- or at least having an obvious way to override with a integration specific substitute rule.
timeline.author: dougqh

replies.bodyText: This was a carry over from DBStatementAsResourceName that I didn't want to unwind.
replies.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: Understandable, but if we're going to undertake a new design, I'd like the new design to have the ability to unwind that mess.  Right now, it isn't clear to me that there's a way to do so.
replies.author: dougqh

timeline.bodyText:
The instanceof checks here strike me as a bit messy as well.
I've wondered for awhile whether we should have a Tags class rather than using Map<String, Object>.
The error prone checks here -- lead to think the answer is yes.
timeline.author: dougqh

replies.bodyText: I'm not opposed to this, but prob not in this PR.
replies.author: tylerbenson

timeline.bodyText: containsKey followed by get is redundant -- unless we're expecting maps with null values.
timeline.author: dougqh

timeline.bodyText: I think I understand what is happening here, but this looks odd and error prone.
timeline.author: dougqh

timeline.bodyText: Not handling a NumberFormatException from parseInt.
timeline.author: dougqh

timeline.bodyText: This logic was repeated elsewhere.  I think we should find a better to encapsulate it.
timeline.author: dougqh

replies.bodyText: This logic is similar, but not the same as Status404Rule
replies.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText:
Yes, there are slight differences, but I think some sharing is possible.
isResourceNameSet() and statusCode checks are the same.
However if there was a helper class to handle the int conversion and comparisons, I think the repetition would be smaller and less problematic.
I'm okay with not fixing this now, but I think there is a problem here.
replies.author: dougqh

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this needs to be under the lock.  Any synchronization for each span should be handled elsewhere.
timeline.author: dougqh

replies.bodyText: Are you suggesting moving it outside the lock? Does it make much difference either way?
replies.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText:
Right, this shouldn't be under the lock.
The extra work will increase the lock hold time -- and that can actually have quite the impact.
For instance, adaptive spinning could cause the lock to be promoted from a spin lock to full lock.
But more importantly, the synchronization here needs to come from the spans not this lock.
Any additional synchronization isn't helping and just increases the likelihood of a deadlock.
replies.author: dougqh

replies.bodyText: ListWriter is primarily used for unit tests.  I'm not so sure it will make a big difference either way.  I can move it outside though if you really want me to.
replies.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText:
Fair enough.
We've got a bit of problem using very coarse grained locking -- even around concurrent collections, so this jumped out at me, but I suppose in this instance, it is okay.
replies.author: dougqh

timeline.author: dougqh

timeline.bodyText:
Are you still calling them decorators?
I understanding supporting the old config, but maybe the method name should be changed.
timeline.author: dougqh

timeline.bodyText:
containsKey / get again.
This does raises a question about the thread safety.  What is the hand-off policy for the span between the creating thread and the processing thread?

timeline.message:
Add TraceProcessor and move some existing functionality to rules

Specifically, the Status5XXRule, URLAsResourceNameRule, and Status404Rule.
Stop setting error tag and update tests.

Use tags instead of meta

which includes baggage.

Avoid setting the error tag

and test fixes.
